Which of the following diagnoses is most likely associated with this finding?

Systemic sclerosis is most likely associated with the digital lesion shown in this image, which demonstrates hyperkeratosis and ulceration of the tip of the third digit. Digital pitting and ulceration of fingertips typically reflects ischemic injury secondary to Raynaud phenomenon. It rarely occurs in primary (idiopathic) Raynaud disease but commonly occurs in patients with secondary Raynaud phenomenon, including systemic sclerosis.

objective.__html: Diagnose digital ulceration due to systemic sclerosis.
